intro: Hypsela subsessilis, commonly known as the narrowleaf hypsela, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces daisy-like yellow flowers with a central disk surrounded by ray florets. It is native to parts of southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. Hypsela subsessilis is often found in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
